name: St. Walburga

locations.description: Abbess of Heidenheim monastery in Germany

summary: Walburga was an English nun and abbess who became a missionary in Germany. She was the sister of St. Willibald and St. Winibald, and the niece of St. Boniface. She joined Boniface's mission to Germany and became the abbess of the double monastery at Heidenheim. She is one of the patron saints of Germany and is particularly venerated in Bavaria. Her relics are enshrined at Eichst√§tt.
